name: Math Problems for Children Quiz | Topics for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: If you have 3 pencils and someone gives you 2 more pencils, how many pencils do you have all together?
questions.explanation:
5.

	The words all together tell you to add the numbers together. Another clue is the word more. 3+2=5

questions.text: You have 7 apples and you eat one. How many apples do you have left?
questions.explanation:
6.

	The words "have left" tell you to subtract. When you subtract you end up with a smaller number than you started with. 7-1=6

questions.text: If I give you 5 pennies and you add the 5 pennies you already have to it, how many pennies do you have?
questions.explanation:
10.

	This time the word add is right in the story problem so you know you need to add the numbers. If you have 10 pennies you have 10 cents. 5+5-10

questions.text: If you have 6 cookies and I take away 5 of them how many cookies do you now have?
questions.explanation:
1.

	Take away are clue words that tell us to subtract. Looking for these clue words help to determine if you add or subtract. 6-5=1

questions.text: You have 4 toy cars and I increase the amount by 5. How many do you have now?
questions.explanation:
9.

	If you increase something you are adding to it. This is another clue word. 4+5=9

questions.text: Let's try some problems with money. If you have $1.00 and lose 25 cents how much money do you have left?
questions.explanation:
75 cents.

	There are 4 quarters (25 cents) in a dollar, so if you lose 1 quarter or 25 cents you will have 3 quarters or 75 cents left. Lose and have left both tell us to subtract.

questions.text: If you have 10 cents and I give you 15 cents what is the total amount of money you have?
questions.explanation:
25 cents.

	10 cents equals 1 US dime. 15 cents equals one dime and one US nickel. 25 cents equals 1 US quarter. When you look for the total amount you find it by using addition.

questions.text: Let's try some two digit problems now. If you have 40 cupcakes and your friends eat 29 of them how many do you have left?
questions.explanation:
11.

	When you subtract 40-29 you have to borrow from the 10s place so you can do the subtraction 10 - 9 and then 3 from 1 to get the answer. Another way to do this problem is to say 40-30 is 10 plus 1 more is 11.

questions.text: You have 35 marbles and you buy 16 more. How many marbles do you have all together?
questions.explanation:
51.

	When you add 35+16 you have to add 5+6 and carry the 1 to the tens place. You then have to add 3+1+1 to get 5. This will give you an answer of 51.

questions.text: If you have 30 popsicles and share with 20 of your friends how many do you have left?
questions.explanation:
10.

	This time you do not have to borrow because you can subtract 0 from 0 and get 0. Once you do that you simply subtract the 3-2 i in the tens place to get 1. This gives you the answer of 10.
